basic_info.description: My name is Luis Rosales.I’m an Outbound Maintenance Supervisor in the US. Army. I’m currently studying Advanced Software Development in Full-Stack JavaScript at Code Fellows. Code Fellows has been challenging but being in the US Army taught me how to overcome challenges and become a problem solver. I’ve always loved tech, but my passion for coding first arose when I started studying Python as a self taught developer. Watching how I could create amazing applications out of code is second to none for me.  I gained some months’ programming experience during my studies, but am now looking to gain more experience, hopefully as a junior level developer. If the opportunity knocks I am open to internships or software developer positions at SMEs in the technology sector. I believe the skills the Army has given me can make me a valuable asset to your team.

projects.title: Animal Shelter
projects.description: The most expanded application I had opportunity to work with. I've learned many technologies and my code was reviewed by awesome curator. Application handles all adoption processess and allows to store all evidence on adopting animals from animal shelter.

projects.title: Photography
projects.description: Personal project for study subject. I was responsible for testing photography application that optimizes images with popular algorithms used by graphic editors like Pixlr or Adobe Photoshop. I've earned A grade :)

projects.title: 3D Object Viewer
projects.description: One of the first apps I was working on my internship. I had to develop front-end implementation for app that shows 3D models of known buildings. This was also my first project in Angular framework. I've learned a lot!
